response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (20 years old)", "medium", "Young age is associated with higher recidivism risk, though it is not the strongest predictor in isolation."],
    ["Race and Gender (White male)", "low", "Being a White male does not independently elevate risk as compared to other demographic factors."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest and conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest and conviction indicate a criminal record, modestly increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Physical Attributes (6'1\", 150-174 lbs)", "low", "Height and weight are not strongly correlated with recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status (never married)", "low", "While being unmarried might have a minor influence, it is less relevant compared to other risk factors."],
    ["Living Situation (not living alone)", "low", "Not living alone may offer social support, reducing risk slightly."],
    ["Education (high school diploma, not in college)", "medium", "Limited higher education may correlate with fewer opportunities, contributing to recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment (no job in the past year)", "high", "Unemployment is a strong risk factor for recidivism due to economic and social stressors."],
    ["Substance Use (used marijuana and cocaine in past 4 years)", "high", "Recent drug use, especially including cocaine, is strongly associated with increased risk of recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health (occasional depressed mood)", "medium", "Symptoms of depression may hinder rehabilitation and increase likelihood of reoffending."],
    ["Family Background (lived with biological mother in a rural household of 4)", "low", "A stable rural family background provides some mitigating factors against recidivism."],
    ["Religious Belief (believes God has nothing to do with his life)", "medium", "A lack of religious or spiritual affiliation may indicate reduced social support networks, influencing risk moderately"]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with higher recidivism risk, though it is not the strongest predictor in isolation.
Being a White male does not independently elevate risk as compared to other demographic factors.
A prior arrest and conviction indicate a criminal record, modestly increasing recidivism risk.
Height and weight are not strongly correlated with recidivism risk.
While being unmarried might have a minor influence, it is less relevant compared to other risk factors.
Not living alone may offer social support, reducing risk slightly.
Education (high school diploma, not in college)
Limited higher education may correlate with fewer opportunities, contributing to recidivism risk.
Employment (no job in the past year)
Unemployment is a strong risk factor for recidivism due to economic and social stressors.
Substance Use (used marijuana and cocaine in past 4 years)
Recent drug use, especially including cocaine, is strongly associated with increased risk of recidivism.
Symptoms of depression may hinder rehabilitation and increase likelihood of reoffending.
Family Background (lived with biological mother in a rural household of 4)
A stable rural family background provides some mitigating factors against recidivism.
Religious Belief (believes God has nothing to do with his life)
A lack of religious or spiritual affiliation may indicate reduced social support networks, influencing risk moderately

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 1 inch and weighs between 150 and 174 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in a rural area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
